Fri, 28 Jun 2024 03:00:00 +0000 What was the name of Donald Sutherland's character in the Hunger Games series? Photo / AP
NZ Army exercises helps prepare soldiers for the worst https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/nz-army-exercise-helps-prepare-soldiers-for-the-worst/7H56U7K4KVEQTHTY47YLZKIG3Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/nz-army-exercise-helps-prepare-soldiers-for-the-worst/7H56U7K4KVEQTHTY47YLZKIG3Q/ Mike ScottRealistic scenarios help soldiers keep ready for any eventuality.Fri, 28 Jun 2024 02:43:18 +0000 The New Zealand Army has been busy holding exercises at its Waiouru training area. This included 12 days of Exercise Vengeance, involving Victor Company from the 1st Battalion Royal New Zealand Infantry Regiment, culminating in a live-fire simulated attack involving supporting machine guns, snipers and reconnaissance. Photo / Mike Scott

Photo / Jason Dorday

Migrant group horrified by ‘ruthless, insensitive’ changes to work visa scheme https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/migrant-group-horrified-by-ruthless-insensitive-changes-to-work-visa-scheme/MZ64RVZEFFE6PECRWMWT5D7WNM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/migrant-group-horrified-by-ruthless-insensitive-changes-to-work-visa-scheme/MZ64RVZEFFE6PECRWMWT5D7WNM/ A group representing migrant workers describes changes to visa rules as 'heart-wrenching'. Fri, 28 Jun 2024 00:30:54 +0000 The Union Network of Migrants says the changes announced by Immigration Minister Erica Stanford (pictured) in February were “abrupt and insensitive". Photo / Mark Mitchell
Rains ease off in time for Hawke’s Bay’s Matariki weekend, chill sets in https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/rains-ease-off-in-time-for-hawkes-bays-matariki-weekend-chill-sets-in/RVJ6FS2WR5BQJBO7BJZ6VES55E/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/rains-ease-off-in-time-for-hawkes-bays-matariki-weekend-chill-sets-in/RVJ6FS2WR5BQJBO7BJZ6VES55E/ The end of the low pressure system means near zero-degree nights ahead. Fri, 28 Jun 2024 00:19:29 +0000 Grey clouds lingered over Napier on Friday, but the forecast for the region is looking positive. Photo / James Pocock
Long-range NZ forecast: More deluges possible mid-July as La Nina looms https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/long-range-forecast-more-deluges-possible-mid-july-as-la-nina-looms/UUBECJKG5FDJFNTWH7WCNIDKNE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/long-range-forecast-more-deluges-possible-mid-july-as-la-nina-looms/UUBECJKG5FDJFNTWH7WCNIDKNE/ Jamie MortonAfter this week's soaking, a Niwa forecaster isn’t ruling out more winter downpours. Fri, 28 Jun 2024 00:18:20 +0000 An area of Haumoana at Beach Rd, beside the Four Square, that is prone to coastal inundation. The house in the background is already long abandoned due to the risk of inundation. A slow-moving storm has smashed the Tairāwhiti and Hawke’s Bay regions overnight, bringing rough seas, gale-force winds and heavy rain, with more to come today. New Zealand Herald photograph by Paul Taylor 26 June 2024
